page.title: 01Spittal of Glenmuick
page.content: This land is part of the Royal Estate of Balmoral, but is also a Nature Reserve managed by the Scottish Wildlife Trust. During the last Ice Age, the classic U-shaped valley itself was formed, and left behind were the cold waters of Loch Muick. New plantaitons of Pine and Larch now clothe the valley bottom The old drove road over the Capel Mount to Glen Clova provided the link between the highland glen and the lowland cattle markets. Next to the old 'hospice' building is a Visitor Centre where information about mountain and moorland flora and fauna is displayed. A mountain rescue post provides walkers and climbers with access to emergency services. The area is an unoffical sanctuary for red deer which are fed by a gamekeeper during the often severe winter months. Other
